The idea is to get into the editor and

The purpose is to get the right scale

The point of using the simple shapes is

First and most importantly is build
mode. This is the unique game mechanic
that has defined Fortnite as a game and
now as a platform. Players can toggle on
this feature during gameplay and
essentially build their own level or
create cover on the fly using walls,
floors, ramps, and cones that all
connect on a structural grid. This
allows for infinite strategies and
creates unique scenarios in just about
every game that it's a part of.
However, this does come with a very high
skill gap that can be very difficult to
master and has the player base in
Fortnite somewhat split. Some players
prefer games with build mode, others
prefer games without it. It's tough to
say exactly what that split looks like,

majority of players are still in favor

Next thing to consider is player

mantle up ledges. They can even climb

These movement features here are default

Pay special attention to how this

Number one is player choices. Players

about timing of choices, or how

lot to players.
Objects that align a [snorts] hallway or
around a corner, like pipes or wires,
can be used as a reference for pathing
while also contributing to the theme of
your game. Other visual aids, such as
stripes or paint on the floor, can also
be helpful suggestions for the players,
but might go overlooked if they're too
subtle.
The clearest way to guide players in a
specific direction is to make the other
option not an option. Either remove that
pathway entirely or just block it off
with obstacles.
However you choose to lead the player,
make sure that you're making it easily
visible so that players can identify and
choose their path prior to arriving to
the space.
